(cont'd) (weeping) They took my  hand ... Paul turns and  starts running. Faster than he's ever run in his life. Di dark street.
Small and  trendy. Young clientele.
Julia sits at  an empty booth. Staring at various black and white photog The four friends are sitting together on the back porch, She squeezes  her finger to help numb the pain, her mind turning.

(to  herself) Joey ... (then) Terry, what  were you talking about? Julia flips to  another photograph. A picture of Julia, Paul, Sam, and Te Dressed for graduation. Julia shakes  her head. Her eyes are locked on the faces of her friends
(cont'd) There's four of  us. There's only four of us. Beat. She studies the  picture ... Beat. Julia sits up in her chair.  A revelation  crosses her face.
(cont'd) (a  whisper) Who took the  picture? Julia looks  like she's falling into a deep hole. Her mind is racing f
I've been  fantasizing about a guy.
Anyone we  know?
The BLOND  STUDENT sits back on the hood of a sports car. The tattoo on his shoulder.
(cont'd) There were five  of us. He came up in his own car.
style="TEXT-TRANSFORM: none"> Paul smiling his killer grin at Julia. Wearing his  white shirt and gold and blue striped tie.
He was Paul's  best friend --
The BLOND  STUDENT loosens his gold and blue striped tie from his wh undresses.
(V.O.) (cont'd
-- they always  wore the same thing for Christ sakes.
Julia's HORRIFIED FACE.
(completely  lost) No ...
The BLOND  STUDENT standing half-naked in front of Julia. Holding a jeans.
(cont'd) I'm sorry. I  was just using the ... (laughs) Really. I'm  sorry.
I'll forgive  you this once.
Julia turns her  head and gazes at ...
Sitting in a  chair. Smoking a cigarette. Smiling down at her.
It's just a  fantasy.

Candles have  been placed around the room. Paul and Terry are asleep on Blood drips  over the SUPERMAN TATTOO on Joey's shoulder. Julia slowly  awakens to the sounds of JOEY SCREAMING over sickening RI being torn in half. There are  silhouettes on the wall of THREE  FIGURES tearing off pieces of something in the room. Larg rapidly and ferociously. Julia spots Sam  SCREAMING across the room.
(shrieking)

Julia turns her  head in the direction of the ripping and tearing sounds. as her mouth drops into a soundless, petrified look of ho A hand with  midnight skin, six fingers, and punctured with steel rods

A plate SMASHES  on the floor. Julia is jolted  out of her thought, looks over to find a WAITER picking u lights flicker in the shop. This unnerves Julia completel the photographs together. She becomes  aware of the pain in her finger again. Looks at the scab.
(a  whisper) Terry's legs  ... Paul's headaches ... A thought  crashes like thunder in her head.
(cont'd) Oh no ... Julia quickly  grabs a knife from the table. She gets up and walks strai restroom.

Cramped and  dirty. Julia holds her finger over the sink. With the point  of the knife's blade, she begins digging into her finger. Julia grimaces, tears forming in her eyes, as the wound b Blood drips into the sink
Julia drops the  knife into the sink and pinches the wound. Squeezing hard A speck of metal flashes inSIDE the  wound . Julia continues  squeezing, tears rolling, fingernails digging into the wo

head_text.subj: METAL SPLINTER PUSHES UP THROUGH THE BLOOD.

text: Julia starts  pulling it out of her finger. The splinter rises from the ... and rises ... More blood  spatters into the sink. Julia is  GASPING and CRYING as the pain becomes excruciating. The five inches long and growing. The splinter is pulled out. It's seven inches  long . Julia drops the  splinter into the sink. She moves away from the counter, room, unbelieving, horrified ... She stumbles  towards the door.

Julia walks out  of the restroom. Stops cold. Everyone in the  coffee shop is staring at her. The customers. The waiters The lights are  dimming. A lack of power. Julia forces  herself to move. She goes to her table, picks up the phot notices that in the graduation pictures --

head_text.subj: HAVE DISAPPEARED. ALMOST AS IF THEY NEVER WERE A PART OF
JULIA ARE TOGETHER IN EVERY PICTURE

text: Julia grabs the  photographs and turns around. The customers  in the coffee shop are standing now. Their eyes are dark about the way they stand is completely unnatural. All wro Panic begins to  settle in. Julia quickly walks to the door.
Julia? She turns. The  waiter stands behind her. Eyes burning.
(cont'd) (menacing) Why'd you take  it out? That's enough.  Julia gets the hell out of there.
Julia bolts out  the door and rushes across the street. She reaches her ca and gets inside.
Julia drops the  photos into the passenger seat. Starts the car. The CELL answers it.
Hello?
Paul on a pay  phone. There's panic in his voice.
Julia. It's  Paul.
Where are  you?
At a pay  phone.
What about your  Dad?
He wouldn't let  me in. He told me he didn't have a son. (then) Julia,  everything in my wallet's gone. Credit cards. Money. Driv Everything.
between Julia and Paul.
Then it's  already started.
What's  started? Terrified beat.  Julia trains her eyes on the coffee shop.
Listen. There's  not much time. They're watching me right now.
Who is?
Just listen to  me. There were five of us at the cabin. (beat) Your best  friend was with us. Joey. He had blond hair. He had a Sup shoulder.
I don't know  anyone named Joey.
That's because  they erased your memory. If you remembered him ... if you did to him, you might run like Sam. That would make it ha down.
Where's  Sam?
He's dead.
What?
They killed  him.
They?
Monsters. Paul can barely  stand up. His skull is pounding.
Monsters?
They really  exist, Paul. They use human beings for parts. Like machin
I can't take  this.
What you saw in  the forest wasn't a hallucination. They've been watching Following us.
I can't --
There's a  tracking device in your head. Right where the scab is. Her words sound  chilling in the night air. Foreboding and deadly. Paul is
My head?
They want us  for parts. That's why they're tracking us. They take the
Just let me  think for a second.
They already  got Sam and Terry. And now they're making us disappear. (then) Think about it.  Your wallet. Your father.
It can't be  true.
It is true!  We're next! Paul becomes  upset. He nods with grave understanding.
What are we  gonna do?
We have to get  back home. They're all over the place, but we can make it
Okay.
Where are  you?
Just below  Union Square. Right near the cable cars. Where they turn
All right.  There's a subway station near there.
I can see  it.
Wait for me. At  the top of the stairs. I'll be there in five minutes.
Okay.
I love you.
(in  pain) I love you.  Please hurry. Paul hangs  up.
Julia tosses  down the cell phone. The car engine STOPS.
What now? She tries to  start the car, but it the engine won't turn over. Just as second time, she looks out the windshield.

Steam rises  from the pipes. Bathing the stairwell in mist. The fluorescent  lights above are glimmering in the darkness. Julia stands stairwell. She can't even see the bottom of the steps. A metal scatters down ahead of her. The HUMMING OF  MACHINES is closer now. Just beyond the sheathing clouds mist. The metal  railing is suddenly replaced by HUMAN BONES. Julia pulls her  hand away from the railing. Looks skyward and discovers m used to brace the ceiling along with metal beams. She stops.  Shutting her eyes in fear. Starts to lose control. From somewhere  within, she manages to steady herself. Keeps going throug curtain at the bottom.

as she looks  around the corner. The shape has disappeared. Carefully she  keeps going forward. Drenched in water and sweat. Slippin clouds that mask another entrance.

A massive room  where empty human skins are dangling from hooks, complete head to toe. The skins sway and rock gently in the draft. Julia moves  towards the center of the room. Paul. Paul,  wake up. He stirs. His  nose crinkles slightly.

Pressed Sliding towards the crawl space opening. Paul starts  advancing into the corridor. Grinning with teeth that fla the strobe light. She keeps  sliding away ... He grabs his  chest and RIPS IT OPEN, tearing the covering skin apart a menagerie of human bones and metal are revealed behind it Julia tries to  scream. Eyes wide. She can't make a sound. Paul tears the  skin covering his chest wider. Pulling it away. Stripping Julia reaches  the crawl space. Sliding down. The last pieces  Paul's skin are torn off. The thing that had been pretend in his place. Only brief  glimpses are allowed by the strobe light. An abysm of imm consisting of fashioned human parts and twisted metal. A within exposed ribs. head_text.subj: CHORUS OF PURSUING MONSTROUS SCREAMS RISE UP WITHIN THE T

text: Julia runs  directly parallel to the subway platform. The lights alon flickering and go out, one by one, as she advances.

She reaches the  opposite tunnel and grabs hold of the platform, pulling h goes dark. Appearing out  of the far tunnel are a DOZEN DARK SHAPES, scampering alo running on all fours across the tracks. Their characteris visible. Julia kicks  back as the shrieking things bear down on her, yellow eye metal teeth flashing. Julia tries to  run for the escalator, but the things cover the walls beh to spring. Finally, one of  the monsters does leap towards her ...

text: Reducing the  monster to a few vestiges of scattered metal. The other c are also run down. Julia watches  as the train RUMBLES past. And then, silence. Nothing is left  except for a few swirling newspapers. The lights flicker life. Rising up to  her feet, rescued from death by chance, Julia starts back escalator. text: Lightning  flashes across the picture's glass frame.
The afternoon  rush of people trying to get home.
THREE COLLEGE STUDENTS come down the escalator into the s them, now eighteen and wearing a Berkeley sweatshirt. His MIKE.
Why the hell  didn't we bring the car?
You wanna pay  for gas?
Better than  this shit. I hate BART.
He has a point.  I made the mistake of trying to use the bathroom. What do with their ass hanging over the toilet and aim? Connor checks  his watch.
We're late.  Party started an hour ago.
We'll make  it.
(trace  of sarcasm) Yeah Connor.  Relax. We might get there right after the kegs dry out.
(resigned) I should study  anyway.
calls out from across the platform.
Connor? He turns around  and scans the crowd, locating a ragged figure that moves With her dirty clothing and sunken eyes, it takes a momen Julia. Her skin is pale. Her hair is stringy and knotted.
I've been  looking for you.
What?
(hushed) Great.
Just ignore  her.
They tried to  get me. Several times. But I  managed to get away. I've always managed to get away. A train rushes  into the station. Connor is speechless.
I'm ... sorry  ..
But you'll help  me. You will help me. Connor raises  his hands and backs towards the train as the doors slide already aboard.
I'm sorry.
No, wait ...  it's Julia ... don't you remember? He gets into  the train. His friends are laughing. Connor turns to his smirking disbelief.
How the fuck  did she know my name?
She heard me  say it.
Jesus  Christ.
(overlapping) It's Julia! I'm  your sister! The doors slide  closed in her face.
Julia begins  beating on the doors to be heard. Connor and his friends but they're still laughing at her.
The train  starts to move. People inside move in front of the doors of her brother.
(cont'd)
Julia runs  alongside the train. Still beating on the doors. Her face
(cont'd)
(shrieks)

The train picks  up speed. Julia is left behind. The grinding of  the wheels is heard as the train moves into the subway tu The sound of machines drowns out every  other sound and consumes all. BLACKOUT.
